page.title: 03FARMING : BOARHILLS
page.content: There are three farms situated within the village of Boarhills, each privately owned. Most of the land which is farmed is under some form of cultivation : cereals, potatoes and vegetables, and only on the higher more exposed land are a few beef cattle kept. Farmers aim to sell most of their barley for malting, and vegetables go direct to vegetable packing stations. Trees,except those around the village, are relatively scarce in this area because farmers use as much of the land as possible and the only new woodland areas are found on the steeper slopes of the Kenley Burn. Field boundaries are usually stone walls, although hawthorn hedges line the roads. These support many other hedgerow plants and animals.
